body:
Hey guys, today was 9/11, and it is a very emotional day for the U.S., feel free to share on how you or anyone you know has been affected by 9/11.

Personally, my mom had an old friend who worked where the hit zone was in the South Tower of the WTC. Anything else, I don't want to specify.

-Perhaps

replies.body:
Uh.

I have a friend who's birthday is on 9/11? :P

Everyone's been giving their condolences to them, heheh.

I give my sympathy to those who lost family and friends in the tragedy, although.

replies.body: Such a tradgedy this day was. My heart is out with all those who lost loved ones.

replies.body:
Yesterday was 9/11. A crane crashed on Grand Mosque and so far 107 are dead. The crane was owned the a company which the Bin Laden family owned.

It's pretty ironic, but it's truly sad.

More info here: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3231117/At-62-people-dead-crane-collapses-Grand-Mosque-Mecca...

Rest in piece all those who died in 2001, and yesterday.

replies.body: With the growing age of this generation (including me) I found that my class took it more of a joke. Although I am from Australia and didn't effect me (I am only 13, so I wasn't born when the bombings happened) I still feel like it is a very serious topic and shouldn't be a joke. All my respects go towards to people who died on that day.
